Consider a control system where the state of a system is described by the differential equation \\( \\dot{x} = Cx + Du \\), where C and D are constant matrices and u is a control input. Assume the control input is transformed according to \\( g(u) = K e^{Lt} u \\), where K and L are also constant matrices.

If an additional transformation \\( h(u) = M e^{Nt} u \\) where M and N are constant matrices, is applied at time \\( t_1 \\), will the final state \\( x(T) \\) for T > t_1 depend only on matrices C and D?
Explanation: The introduction of another control transformation \\( h(u) \\) further complicates the system dynamics. The final state \\( x(T) \\) at time T > t_1 will depend on the interaction of all matrices (C, D, K, L, M, N) throughout the timeline, altering the original trajectory and final outcome.
